elements

Buttons

Flat Buttons

Raised Buttons

Flat buttons are typically used for less-pronounced actions. In cards, Flat buttonshelp maintain an emphasis on card content. Raised buttons are high-emphasis, distinguished by their use of elevation and fill. They contain actions that are primary to your app. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <h3>Flat Buttons</h3> <div class="button-wraper"> <button class="da-button button-style">Default</button> <button class="da-button da-flat-button_colored button-style">Colored</button> <button class="da-button da-flat-button_disabled button-style">Disabled</button> </div> <h3>Raised Buttons</h3> <div class="button-wraper"> <button class="da-button da-raised-button_default button-style">Default</button> <button class="da-button da-raised-button_colored button-style">Colored</button> <button class="da-button da-raised-button_disabled button-style">Disabled</button> </div> Cards Cards are surfaces that display content and actions on a single topic.They should be easy to scan for relevant and actionable information. Elements, like text and images, should be placed on them in a way that clearly indicates hierarchy. Although cards can support multiple actions, UI controls, and an overflow menu, use restraint and remember that cards are entry points to more complex and detailed information.

Cards are a convenient means of displaying content composed of different types of objects.

Card headline title

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores.No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua.

Card with image header

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores.No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua.

For the creation of the above examples of cards, you can use the classes of thelibrary, which are given in the code below: <div class="da-card card-style"> <div class="da-card__text"> <p>Cards are a convenient means of displaying content composed of different types of objects.</p> </div> <div class="da-card__button"> <button class="da-button card-style__button">Hurray!</button> </div> </div> <div class="da-card card-style"> <div class="da-card__title">Card headline title</div> <div class="da-card__text"> <p> Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores.No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua.</p> </div> <hr class="da-card__line"> <div class="da-card__button"> <button class="da-button card-style__button">More info...</button> <button class="da-button card-style__button card-style__button_indent">Decline</button> <button class="da-button da-flat-button_colored card-style__button">Accept</button> </div> </div> <div class="da-card card-style"> <div class="da-card__header card-style__header"><img class="da-card__image" src="images/card_picture.png" alt=""> <div class="da-card__title da-card__image-title card-style__image-title">Card with image header</div> </div> <div class="da-card__text"> <p> Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores.No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua.</p> </div> <hr class="da-card__line"> <div class="da-card__button"> <button class="da-button card-style__button">More info...</button> <button class="da-button card-style__button card-style__button_indent">Decline</button> <button class="da-button da-flat-button_colored card-style__button">Accept</button> </div> </div> Checkbox Checkboxes allow the user to select one or more items from a set. Checkboxescan be used to turn an option on or off. If you have multiple options appearing in a list, you can preserve space by using checkboxes instead of on/off switches. If you have a single option, avoid using a checkbox and use an on/off switch instead.
Notify me about updates to apps or games that I’ve downloaded Auto-update apps over wifi only Remove all the searches you have ever performed
You can see the example code below: <div class="checkbox-style__block"> <input class="da-checkbox" id="notific" type="checkbox" name="notifications"> <label class="da-checkbox-label" for="notific"><span class="da-checkbox__logo"> <svg width="12px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 12 10"> <polyline points="1.5 6 4.5 9 10.5 1"></polyline> </svg></span><span class="da-checkbox__title">Notifications</span></label><span class="da-checkbox-desc checkbox-style__indent">Notify me about updates to apps or games that I’ve downloaded</span> <input class="da-checkbox" id="updat" type="checkbox" name="update"> <label class="da-checkbox-label" for="updat"><span class="da-checkbox__logo"> <svg width="12px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 12 10"> <polyline points="1.5 6 4.5 9 10.5 1"></polyline> </svg></span><span class="da-checkbox__title">Auto-updates</span></label><span class="da-checkbox-desc checkbox-style__indent">Auto-update apps over wifi only</span> <input class="da-checkbox" id="clear" type="checkbox" name="clear"> <label class="da-checkbox-label" for="clear"><span class="da-checkbox__logo"> <svg width="12px" height="10px" viewBox="0 0 12 10"> <polyline points="1.5 6 4.5 9 10.5 1"></polyline> </svg></span><span class="da-checkbox__title">Clear search history</span></label><span class="da-checkbox-desc">Remove all the searches you have ever performed</span> </div> Data Tables Data tables display information in a way that’s easy to scan, so that users canlook for patterns and insights. They can be embedded in primary content, such as cards. Data tables can include: a corresponding visualization; navigation; tools to query and manipulate data. When including tools, they should be placed directly above or below the table.

A data table contains a header row at the top that lists column names, followedby rows for data. Dialog

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores. No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua.

Id qui scripta laboramus dissentiet, verterem partiendo vim atStet dissentiet ut mei. Iriure facilis eloquentiam pro eu, nec an esse inciderint. In meliore abhorreant sea. Eros nostro ocurreret at nec. Cu per regione persecuti.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores. No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua.

Dialog are surfaces that display content and actions on a single topic.They should be easy to scan for relevant and actionable information. Elements, like text and buttons, should be placed on them in a way that clearly indicates hierarchy. <div class="da-dialog card-style"> <div class="da-dialog__title">Dialog</div> <div class="da-card__text"> <p> Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. FAB Speed Dial are typically used for less-pronounced actions. They contain actions that are primary to your app.The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <nav class="da-fab-speed-dial"><a class="buttons" href="#"> <div class="material-icons grey-m">clear</div></a><a class="buttons" href="#"> <div class="material-icons grey-m">favorite</div></a><a class="buttons" href="#"> <div class="material-icons grey-m">create</div></a><a class="buttons" href="#"> <div class="material-icons white-m">menu</div></a></nav> Floating Action Button
Regular
Mini
A floating action button (FAB) performs the primary, or most common, action on a screen. It appears in front of all screen content, typically as a circular shape with an icon in its center. FABs come in three types: regular, mini. Only use a FAB if it is the most suitable way to present a screen’s primary action. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <div class="floating-button-wraper"> <div class="da-floating-button"> <div class="da-floating-button__discription da-floating-button__style">Regular</div> <button class="da-floating-button__arrow-icon da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons white">arrow_forward</div> </button> <button class="da-floating-button__create-icon da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons white">create</div> </button> <button class="da-floating-button__add-icon da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">add</div> </button> </div> <div class="da-floating-button-m"> <div class="da-floating-button-m__discription da-floating-button-m__style">Mini</div> <button class="da-floating-button-m__done da-icon-button-m__style"> <div class="material-icons white">done</div> </button> <button class="da-floating-button-m__reply da-icon-button-m__style"> <div class="material-icons white">reply</div> </button> <button class="da-floating-button-m__clear da-icon-button-m__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">clear</div> </button> </div> </div> Icon Buttons
icon buttons
styled
segmented
Icon buttons are typically used for different actions. Sometimes you might want to have icons for certain button to enhance the UX of the application as we recognize logos more easily than plain text. For example, if you have a delete button or create you can label it with a dustbin icon. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <div class="icon-button-wraper"> <div class="da-icon-button"> <div class="da-icon-button__discription da-icon-button__style">icon buttons</div> The input tag specifies an input field where the user can enter data. input elements are used within a form element to declare input controls that allow users to input data. An input field can vary in many ways, depending on the type attribute. <div class="inputs-wraper"> <input class="da-inputs_simple da-inputs_style" placeholder="Input name" type="text" required> <input class="da-inputs_active-text da-inputs_style" placeholder="Active text input" type="text" required> <div class="da-inputs-3"> <input class="da-inputs_invalid da-inputs_style" placeholder="Invalid text input" type="text" required> <label class="da-inputs-3_lab" for="name">This input requires a value!</label> </div> <input class="da-inputs_disable da-inputs_style" disabled placeholder="I'm disabled" type="text" required> <div class="da-inputs-5"> <input class="da-inputs_floating" id="name" type="text" required=""> <label class="form-control-placeholder" for="name">Floating label</label> </div> <div class="da-inputs-6"> <label class="da-inputs_text-area" for="name">Text area</label> <textarea class="da-inputs_text da-inputs_style" placeholder="Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores. No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua." type="text" required></textarea> </div> </div> Inset Dividers

Divider is a component that allows for Material styling of a line separator with various orientation options.Dividers can be added to lists as a means of separating content into distinct sections. Inset dividers can also be added to provide the appearance of distinct elements in a list without cluttering content like avatar images or icons. The last example of this demo show how to use inset dividers: <div class="da-inset-dividers"> <div class="da-inset-dividers__but da-menu-items__style"> <div class="material-icons darkblue">call </div> </div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription da-menu-items__style">(650) 555-1234</div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription_sm da-menu-items__style">mobile</div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription da-menu-items__style">(323) 555-6789</div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription_sm da-menu-items__style">work</div> <hr class="da-inset-dividers__hr"> <div class="da-inset-dividers__but da-menu-items__style"> <div class="material-icons darkblue">mail_outline</div> </div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription da-menu-items__style">aliconnors@example.com</div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription_sm da-menu-items__style">personal</div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription da-menu-items__style">ali_connors@example.com</div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription_sm da-menu-items__style">work</div> <hr class="da-inset-dividers__hr"> <div class="da-inset-dividers__but da-menu-items__style"> <div class="material-icons darkblue">place</div> </div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription da-menu-items__style">2000 SW 1st Ave San Francisco, CA 94112</div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription_sm da-menu-items__style">home</div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription da-menu-items__style">1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy Mountain View, CA 94043</div> <div class="da-inset-dividers__discription_sm da-menu-items__style">work</div> </div> Lists Lists are a continuous group of text or images. They are composed of itemscontaining primary and supplemental actions, which are represented by icons and text.

A menu displays a list of choices on a temporary surface. They appear when users interact with a button and actions.For example, if you have a delete button or create you can label it with a dustbin icon. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <div class="da-menu-items"> <div class="da-menu-items-el"> <div class="da-menu-items-el__but da-menu-items__style"> <div class="material-icons class="da-menu-items-el__error-icon da-menu-items__style"> <div class="material-icons lgrey">error</div> </div> </div> </div> Menu Dropdown
Recent Articles
Archive
Completed
A dropdown menu is a compact way of displaying multiple choices. It appears upon interaction with an element (such as an icon or button) or when users perform a specific action. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <div class="da-dropdown"> <div class="da-dropdown__el"> <button class="da-dropdown__el_but da-dropdown__style"> <div class="material-icons dgrey">query_builder </div> </button> <div class="da-dropdown__el_discription da-dropdown__style">Recent Articles</div> </div> <div class="da-dropdown__el"> <button class="da-dropdown__el_but da-dropdown__style"> <div class="material-icons dgrey">assignment_returned</div> </button> <div class="da-dropdown__el_discription da-dropdown__style">Archive</div> </div> <div class="da-dropdown__el"> <button class="da-dropdown__el_but da-dropdown__style"> <div class="material-icons dgrey">done</div> </button> <div class="da-dropdown__el_discription da-dropdown__style">Completed</div> </div> </div> Progress Circular Progress indicators inform users about the status of ongoing processes, such asloading an app, submitting a form, or saving updates. They communicate an app’s state and indicate available actions, such as whether users can navigate away from the current screen.
Circular progress support both determinate and indeterminate processes. <div class="progress-circular-style__block"> <div class="progress-circular-1"></div> <div class="progress-circular-2"></div> <div class="progress-circular-3"></div> <div class="progress-circular-4"></div> <div class="progress-circular-5"></div> </div> Progress Linear Linear progress indicators display progress by animating an indicator along thelength of a fixed, visible track. The behavior of the indicator is dependent on whether the progress of a process is known.
Determinate operations display the indicator increasing in width from 0 to 100% ofthe track, in sync with the process’s progress. An example is shown below: <div class="progress-linear-style__block"> <div class="progress-linear-1"></div> <div class="progress-linear-2"></div> <div class="progress-linear-3"></div> <div class="progress-linear-4"></div> <div class="progress-linear-5"></div> <div class="progress-linear-6"></div> </div> Radio Button Radio buttons allow the user to select one option from a set. Use radio buttonswhen the user needs to see all available options. If available options can be collapsed, consider using a dropdown menu because it uses less space. Radio buttons should have the most commonly used option selected by default.
Keep Wi-Fi on during sleep
The code for the buttons above looks like this: <div class="radio-style__block"><span class="da-radio-desc">Keep Wi-Fi on during sleep</span> <input class="da-radio" id="always" type="radio" name="keep"> <label class="da-radio-label" for="always"><span class="da-radio__body"><span class="da-radio__body-center"></span></span><span class="da-radio__title">Always</span></label> <input class="da-radio" id="plug" type="radio" name="keep"> <label class="da-radio-label" for="plug"><span class="da-radio__body"><span class="da-radio__body-center"></span></span><span class="da-radio__title">Only when plugged in</span></label> <input class="da-radio" id="never" type="radio" name="keep"> <label class="da-radio-label" for="never"><span class="da-radio__body"><span class="da-radio__body-center"></span></span><span class="da-radio__title">Never</span></label> </div> Shadow
You can use this style element simply by adding a class to the appropriate block,for example: <div class="shadow-wraper"> <div class="da-shadow-1 shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-2 shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-3 shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-4 shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-5 shadow_style"></div> </div> Slider

Sliders allow users to make selections from a range of values.for example: <div class="da-slidecontainer"> <div class="da-slidecontainer__header">Music, video, games & other media</div> <input class="da-slidecontainer__slider" id="myRange" type="range" min="1" max="100" value="50"> <div class="da-slidecontainer__header">Notifications</div> <input class="da-slidecontainer__slider big-or" id="myRange" type="range" min="1" max="100" value="50"> <div class="da-slidecontainer-with-value"> <div class="da-slidecontainer-with-value__text">R</div> <input class="da-slidecontainer__slider blue" id="myRange1" type="range" min="1" max="100" value="50"><span id="demo"></span> </div> <div class="da-slidecontainer-with-value"> <div class="da-slidecontainer-with-value__text">G</div> <input class="da-slidecontainer__slider big" id="myRange2" type="range" min="1" max="100" value="50"><span id="demo2"></span> </div> <div class="da-slidecontainer-with-value"> <div class="da-slidecontainer-with-value__text">B</div> <input class="da-slidecontainer__slider blue" id="myRange3" type="range" min="1" max="100" value="50"><span id="demo3"></span> </div> <div class="da-slidecontainer__header">Brightness</div> <input class="da-slidecontainer__slider big-gr" id="myRange" type="range" min="1" max="100" value="50"> <div class="da-slidecontainer__header">Ratings</div> <input class="da-slidecontainer__slider big-gr" id="myRange" type="range" min="1" max="100" value="50"> </div> Switch(Toggle) Switches toggle the state of a single setting on or off. They are the preferredway to adjust settings on mobile. The option that the switch controls, as well as the state it’s in, should be made clear from the corresponding inline label.
Example of using elements: <div class="switch-style__block"> <input class="da-switch" id="wifi" type="checkbox"> <label class="da-switch-label" for="wifi"><span class="da-switch__slider da-switch__round"></span>Wi-Fi</label> <input class="da-switch" id="bluetoothe" type="checkbox"> <label class="da-switch-label" for="bluetoothe"><span class="da-switch__slider da-switch__round"></span>Bluetooth</label> <input class="da-switch" id="airplane" type="checkbox"> <label class="da-switch-label" for="airplane"><span class="da-switch__slider da-switch__round"></span>Airplane Mode</label> </div> Tabs Tabs organize and allow navigation between groups of content that are related andat the same level of hierarchy.

Your draft has been discarded.
Connection timed out. Showing limited messages.
Message sent
Materialize provides an easy way for you to send unobtrusive alerts to your users through toasts. These toasts are also placed and sized responsively <div class="da-toast"> <div class="da-toast-first">Your draft has been discarded.</div> <div class="da-toast-connect">Connection timed out. Showing limited messages. <button class="da-toast-connect__button">RETRY</button> </div> <div class="da-toast-message">Message sent</div> </div> Toolbar In computer interface design, a toolbar is a graphical control element onwhich on-screen buttons, icons, menus, or other input or output elements are placed. Toolbars are seen in many types of software such as office suites, graphics editors and web browsers.

Tooltip text
Tooltip text
Tooltip text
Tooltip text
Tooltips display informative text when users hover over, focus on, or tap an element. For example: <div class="da-tooltips-wrapper"> <div class="da-tooltips"> <button class="da-tooltips__arrow-icon da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons white">arrow_forward</div> </button> <div class="tooltip tooltip_left">Tooltip text</div> </div> <div class="da-tooltips"> <button class="da-tooltips__create-icon da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons white">create</div> </button> <div class="tooltip tooltip_bottom">Tooltip text</div> </div> <div class="da-tooltips"> <button class="da-tooltips__add-icon da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">add</div> </button> <div class="tooltip tooltip_top">Tooltip text</div> </div> <div class="da-tooltips"> <button class="da-tooltips__done da-icon-button-m__style"> <div class="material-icons white">done</div> </button> <div class="tooltip tooltip_right">Tooltip text</div> </div> </div>
